meanings.definition: To obstruct or block the flow of water by building a dam.
meanings.sent1: The beavers were damming the stream to create a pond.
meanings.sent2: The engineers were damming the river to generate hydroelectric power.
meanings.sent3: The kids were damming the bathtub with their toys, causing a flood in the bathroom.
meanings.sent4: Her tears were damming up behind her eyes, ready to overflow at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The fallen tree was damming the creek, creating a beautiful natural barrier.
